website_summaries.verdict: An attractive, heavy-duty yet easy-to-tote grill with a few luxe features like a quick igniter and side tables. However, it may frustrate those who want a fast preheat or a deep sear.
pros: Porcelain-coated grates heat evenly and are easy to clean
Grill surface is wide enough for 4 to 5 steaks
Even heating across single oval burner with no hot spots
cons: Lightweight housing doesn’t retain heat as well as steel or cast iron
Unwieldy shape, even with side tables stowed inside grill
Burners can be difficult to clean
Some feel it doesn’t get hot enough to properly sear meat

website_summaries.verdict: Easily grill for a fast lunch or snack, or make a full dinner on this portable grill. An easy solution for any meal, anytime, and any place.
pros: Doesn't rust or need to be seasoned
Sears perfectly to seal in juices and flavor
cons: Burners may not function or last
Low BTU-burner doesn't get hot enough

customer_reviews.title: This grill is great!!
customer_reviews.text: Here is feedback on this that adds a different dimension to all the 5 star reviews. I'm a single woman and don't want to carry the heavy tank. This grill is great!!! And I keep the little 16oz cans in bulk and so easy to replace.. 1 last 4-5 at least meals. Love love love
customer_reviews.author: lachigirl

customer_reviews.title: Still Good
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a Weber and this recent purchase did not disappoint. I had the same model except without the thermometer. I have no regrets with this model. I have literally, 3 grills sitting in my back yard. I needed a gas grill for those times when I did not want to deal with charcoals. I can't say enough about how well Weber grills have been for me. I made my purchase via Amazon because I kept putting off the purchase for nearly 6 months and came to realize I was procrastinating rather severely and so the only way I was going to get the grill was to have it delivered to my door.
customer_reviews.author: K Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to slow cook your meat...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Had the same issue others experienced with grill not getting above 300 degrees. Returning...
customer_reviews.author: MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Hot
customer_reviews.text: It seems like the gas is free-flowing into the grill. It gets to over 500°F on LOW, and none of my digital thermometers can determine the HIGH temperature as they error out on Excessive Heat, somewhere near 725°F. The onboard, analog thermometer is pegged. I'm sure Weber can address the issue, but given the COVID19 precautions, it's impossible to get a hold of anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control issues
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my Q2200 and immediately had issues with controlling the temperature. On the lowest setting, the grill temperature would be 400 degrees Fahrenheit. After several attempts to use it, contacted Weber directly. I was told this is normal, and to continue to use the grill for a couple of weeks, then call back. 2 weeks later, same issue continues, so again I called back, this time Weber will, at no cost, send me a new regulator. I expressed my dissatisfaction repeatedly, I didn't buy a new grill to work on it!! For the time being, this is all they are willing to do. Weber has an unsatisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: Oscar H.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and even heat
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased four of the weber Q series grills now, started with the Q1000 but liked it so much I upgraded to the Q2200 for more cooking space, since then I've bought two more for relatives who absolutely love them and use them for camping, and my nephew still uses my original Q1000 for camping today more than 10 years later.
customer_reviews.author: Ekbruster

customer_reviews.title: Great grill - Perfect for my RV
customer_reviews.text: Initial rating - The grill was delivered on time (Thanks Prime - 2 day). Setup was a breeze. It involved a little bit of "construction". The lid, burner knob, electric starter, handle, and temp gauge all needed to be put together. A phillips head screw driver and 5 minutes later and the grill is ready to go. I hooked up a 20lb propane tank with the LP extended hose (purchased separately). I ran the grill at high setting for 15 min. It didn't take long to get to hot. The temperature held and it was very cold and windy. I will cook on it later and update my review. For now - 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hageman

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for my RV
customer_reviews.text: Looed for a grill to Take on my RV Wanted the most BTUs available and grill surface to accommodate a large piece of meat when entertaining. My home grill is a Weber genesis with 3 burners set vertically . I turn off middle burner for indirect heat cooking. I was concerned with Q2200 having a circular or oblong burner. I can say that I cooked 2 beef tenderloins ( total 15 lbs ) on my Q and it turned out perfect! I couldn’t be more pleased I did buy the mobile cart separately which I really like for taking in/out of my RV and setting up with no need to put the Q on a table.
customer_reviews.author: GQ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two people
customer_reviews.text: The grill is well packaged and easy to assemble. The video assembly instructions on the Weber app are excellent. The split grate is such an improvement over the one piece grate that our old Weber grill had. The new grate half is easier to handle and will fit in the sink to soak for cleaning. The grill gets over 550 degrees which is perfect for pizza making. We use a Cast Elegance 14" Rond stone for wonderfully crisp pizza. The surface of the grate is quite sufficient for 6 chicken breast halves. Temperature regulation is easier with the built-it thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Oven Guy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: This portable grill is amazing. I literally just told my son that this grill exceeded my expectations. I have grilled Mahi Mahi, pork chops and chicken on this Weber Q2200. The only reason I gave it a four star rating on “portability” is the weight of the grill when my wife and I have to carry it outside to my truck. As others have noted it’s heavy but that’s not a bad thing! It shows how well made this is and why it proudly wears the Weber name. Simply put, another home run by Weber!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Taking it to the river
customer_reviews.text: First off I would give it 5 stars. It was late but well worth the wait. I am a huge fan of weber product's. This one is my first gas grill from them and it didn't disappoint. 10 min to assemble did the burn in and burgers were done shortly after that on my first cook. It's cast aluminum and very well made. There are tons of replacement part's available cuz its a weber. 1 LB propane takes last bout 2 and half to 3 hours on high heat. I would recommend getting the hose to conect to a big bottle. $10 fills big bottle vs $10 for 2 little bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Finally Got a Weber - Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Nearly everyone I spoke with told me to get a Weber grill when I next purchased one. I had a very inexpensive other brand in my motor home that I used when on the road. The control knob on it broke so I took the opportunity to finally get a Weber. I love this new grill. It cooks great, doesn't use much propane, and is easy to clean up. It fits in the basement of the motor home, but I do have to remove the two pins required to take the top off to store it. With the top on, it is just about 1/2 inch too tall.
customer_reviews.author: patbisson

customer_reviews.title: Weber Q 2200 - Not Working
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this grill in early April, I have had consistent issues with burner output. I removed burner, cleaned burner, and replaced it several times. It would then have 75 to 100% output, then slowly stop working over a week or two. This grill system is a poor design. I recommend staying with Weber's traditional grill models or try another brand. Very disappointed in the quality of this Weber machine. Furthermore, contacted Weber and never received a response from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality BBQ
customer_reviews.text: Quite hot (500-600 degrees), very nice unit, like the thermometer, echo other pro comments. I'm unaccustomed to the plastic wing-like extension trays, other Weber this replaced did not have those. I fired off the new grill while lid closed, failing to open and move trays away from grill. Big oops but fortunately noticed before any damage was done. You've been warned. Weber cover from old unit did not fit this somewhat larger one.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth cater

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Grill
customer_reviews.text: We got this gas grill & folding table to take down to the beach. Tested it last night on a couple of steaks. Just WOW !! Seared those steaks to perfection !! Got over 500 degrees in about 5 minutes. I have a popular pellet grill as well but I got to say . . . I've forgotten how good a gas seared steak is, & I dont have to plug it in like I have to with the pellet grill. Now one thing, this is on the bigger side for being portable. You dont want to carry this very far. However working great for us.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I expected more from Weber, challenges with the heat
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this unit, the design is good, the quality is pretty solid. What I don't like is that the gas flame will go out when a good wind is present and it does not get that hot (over 350 degrees). The heat is not consistent throughout the grill either. I think I could have found a better portable grill for the $299 I spent...
customer_reviews.author: Todd Carlson

customer_reviews.title: The best little grill in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: The best little grill in my opinion! Why take up so much room with a huge grill unless you entertain a lot of people often. We ordered this one for our son, but we've had the smaller version for going on 15 years. We've had to replace the burner once (we grill at least twice a week) and it travels with us when going to the beach. We hook it up to a large tank here at home, but use the small disposable bottles when traveling. Perfect for our needs of grilling for 2-4 people. My son wanted this larger version because he does grill for 4-6 often.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Great Portability in a competent Gas Grill
customer_reviews.text: We have used this grill at tailgates and at home. It heats fairly quickly and maintains it's heat level very evenly with the gas flow control. The only flaw is the heat distribution. The burner runs in a horseshoe ring around the grill and no matter how long you pre-heat the heat is always greater over the horseshoe. This means you have to move your food numerous times to have it cook evenly. We have cast iron griddles that we place on the grill that will compensate and spread the heat, but then you lose the char of a grill. All-in-all, we like the grill very much for it's portability and easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Easy to deal with.
customer_reviews.text: The Weber Q2200 is easy to use, cook and clean. I've had several grills, and I initially bought this for my RV, but have used it at home quite a bit since I got it. The heat is very easy to control. Might have to get creative for indirect heat since it only has one burner. No biggie. I've bought an 20lb propane bottle hose for low waste compared to 1lb cans. I know you can refill 1lb cans,I think I'm OK with this setup. Hope to get many years of use out of this!
customer_reviews.author: Dabber

customer_reviews.title: Over all good
customer_reviews.text: As per instructions Webber Q grilles act more like a convention oven. So plan on a learning curve. Shorter cooking times. Once you get used to that it works great. So far I have cooked steaks, pork ribs and hamburgers which came out great. Use a timer so you don't over cook them. The only negative is the propane regulator which leaks. So don't leave the propane tank on when your done using the grille. I have the adapter hose and use a 5 gallon propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: sabertooth

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. This was purchased as a replacement grill for the cheap POS we received with our motor home. After removing the regulator and adding a couple of brass fittings it connects to our on-board LPG and fires right up. This grill does not "flame out" and maintains a constant cooking temperature. It is the perfect portable grill for our RV.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Great compact propane grill
customer_reviews.text: Compact grill when I just want to cook a few hotdogs or hamburgers and don't want to fire up my Kamado Joe. Uses small propane tanks and comes with an adapter for the large ones. If you want to use the larger one get the cart which does a great jog holding the tank and tools an brings the grill up to the right height. The cart doesn't fold like the old ones so need a little more room if you want to transport with the cart.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Nice grill for car camping
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality grill and we're happy with it. Assembly was straight forward and the instructions are good. The griddle accessory makes it pretty flexible in terms of what you can do with it. We use it for car camping. It's pretty bulky, heavy and odd shaped, especially with the (optional) stand attached, so it takes up a lot of space and it's a challenge to pack other things around it.
customer_reviews.author: bck17

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this grill so much that this is the second one we have purchased! The first we let our son borrow at his "starter" apartment, but then we ended up needing one for an RV we had to buy for some extended medical stays. Piece of advice - make sure you buy the hose (such as Camco 57282 10' Propane Quick-Connect Hose) & fitting (such as Camco 59903 Propane Quick-Connect Fitting - 1/4" NPT x Full Flow Male Plug) to convert it over to use a normal propane bottle rather than the little ones. It is MUCH more convenient that way!! :)
customer_reviews.author: little becky

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, heavy, and frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: This grill worked great for about 4 cooks than turned into a boat anchor. The burner won’t light and I have gone through the stages of resetting the regulator more times than I can count. I thought I could count on a quality product from Weber but I guess I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wass

customer_reviews.title: Don’t forget the side tables are attached!
customer_reviews.text: The little plastic side tables are very weak and useless. I accidentally forgot they were fold it in and started to heat up the grill and they melted and caught fire immediately. The grill itself is nice but the side tables are useless and dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: We bought this grill for camping and my husband really ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this grill for camping and my husband really likes this grill. We tried a few other ones that are available on the market, but a Weber is a Weber. The others would get hot spots and with them being small grills it was guaranteed to have burned food, not with this Weber. Definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Heike Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Weber August 10th 2019, used it one camping trip and a few times at home. It stopped working by May. The heat output was very poor. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen R. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Weber builds a fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Best gas grill I've ever owned. Just upgraded from a 7 year old q2000, still working fine, my kids took it. The new one is 12,000 btu. It pre heats to 500° in less than 5 minutes! It cooks at a perfect 350° on low. The q-shape burner allows for indirect grilling on the inner half of the grill. Large enough to feed several people. Small enough to take camping.
customer_reviews.author: daniel shupe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, compact, effective  grill for small space
customer_reviews.text: Great grill. Beautiful markings from cast iron grates. More assembly required than I expected (our handyman completed in about 30 min including unboxing, but would have taken us much longer to assemble). Perfect size for smaller family who wants to cook 4 pieces of meat at a time over fairly high / direct heat or more if using edges of grilling surface.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Bitner

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My son has the Q2100 and it was perfect for camping so I needed to get one for the RV and felt that the larger surface space of the Q2200 would be perfect. This grill is fairly lightweight and have a lot of cooking space. We cooked 5 burgers with two polish sausage links with room to spare. Good heat distribution. All in all very please with this purchase and look forward to many years of cooking in the great outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: I love my Weber
customer_reviews.text: I've had several Weber grills, so I'm familiar with them. Once you start using these bad boys anything else is second rate. This grill is very compact; its table top. Great for outings. The heat distribution is 'Weber good'. Burgers and hot dogs come out great. You can even cook a 'Pittsburgh rare' steak with this grill. The quality of the grill is superb. It will last a long time. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Ray C.

customer_reviews.title: Whats up with the gas valve?
customer_reviews.text: It's great! sometime other times you can't cook toast on it it i clean it let it burn off whats up with the gas valve very inconsistent cooking flame no difference between high and low maybe I got a lemon! It's a webber! ox#&%$@!mFer! Certified piece of junk very unsatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Grill
customer_reviews.text: We are downsizing from a Big Grill. We no longer want to haul the big tank or clean a Big grill. We chose the 2200Q and it is perfect for us. The single burner is just right and the heavy grate is quality. The directions for assembly are not so good. Whenever you do not use words and just draw simple pictures....it's like playing charades as to what they mean. But we did OK.... DO NOT BUY THE FOLDING CART. We did . HUGE MISTAKE. It is junky quality and wobbles like mad with the 2200 Q.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT HEAT UP, ELEMENT AND VALVES SEEM BLOCKED.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of crap! NOT satisfied at all! Element and valves do not work, does not get hot enough to grill a steak. It's been lit for an hour and is at 200 degrees. I want to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Zola

customer_reviews.title: Great product. We are first year motor home owners
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We are first year motor home owners. Cooking inside is inconvenient ... everything is small. So now we cook outside on the new weber. And to keep things clean and neat we use disposable cookie trays to cook on. It works great and there's no clean up on the grill. we got this tip from some other campers.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry F. Perpetua

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty awesome. I've used the adapter for a 30lbs tank as well as the small camping bottle. Both work just fine. It heats good, cooks good and in general does everything you'd expect. I've cooked several things on it and all turned out good. Brats didn't flare up (cooked slow and turned often), fish did good (used a grille mat to prevent fall through). I've no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L

customer_reviews.title: I love my new grill!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with my new Weber!! I use this grill for our main grill. It replaces a full sized gas grill and I have no regrets. It works well for our family of 4 and cooks our food to perfection. I am the primary user of this grill, as my husband prefers to use charcoal. Since the Weber arrived, this mom is now the grill master in this house. Perfect size for a small family and I can easily bring it inside to keep it protected through our tough winters.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie VanderJagt

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is great. But as you can see in the picture the cart Weber sells for it is just too flimsy, so i bought this roller cart on Amazon and mounted the grill and an LP bottle to it. Now it’s stable and works great for in and out of garage. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product giving great results.
customer_reviews.text: How on earth anyone can complain about the difficulty in assembly is beyond me. Two screws, a wing nut, and a couple of pins. 10 minutes max to do the job. If you had difficulty with this, I strongly advise you have a fire extinguisher and ambulance on standby when using this grill because chances are it will not end well. Bottom line, a great little grill. Easy to use, easy to clean, and grills prefectly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: one at home) I like the grill a lot
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these, bought at different times. (two at my cabin, one at home) I like the grill a lot. Cast iron, heavy, cleans decently. The burner tubes themselves DO rust out, but slowly. Sometimes you have to go in and clean out the orifices but... ok. I use them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Best grill
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a 19 year old Q grill with this one. This grill heats up quickly, cleans easily, has a handy thermometer, and doesn't take up a lot of space. These grills last a long time. The only thing wrong with the old one was, after 19 years, the igniter stopped working and we couldn't find a replacement. Great grill!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Weber Q
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill. Had planned to spend a lot of money on a large grill when I accidentally found this and a bunch of very positive reviews. Looked on Youtube, and found quite a few videos on using this grill. Decided to buy it and have been patting myself on the back for my brilliant decision. It's just my wife and I, and we only grill burgers (fantastic), chicken, etc. Everything has been perfect. Like I said, I love this grill...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Denson

customer_reviews.title: Loving this Grill
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this grill. It is well made, heavy. It heats up well and evenly. I got the connector to attach it to a larger propane tank, so that works fine. The grill has plenty of room. Of course, you are not able to do anything over indirect heat because there is one oval burner.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Carter

customer_reviews.title: Weber Quality
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Weber Q120 after racoons damaged it at a campground. This new Q2200 one works better than my old one and has a bigger cooking surface. No problem heating this to over 600 degrees. I use it with a 20 lb. tank and adaptor, no problem. My 14-3/4" pizza stone fits on it perfect too.
customer_reviews.author: slowolf

customer_reviews.title: Great grill. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great grill. Sears and cooks very well. I use this with a 20lb propane tank on my balcony. It is used more than just a few times per week and the propane tank lasts for months. I would recommend this grill to anyone looking for an amazing grill to fit an apartment balcony or any small space. Cleaning the grates are a bit annoying because they are great quality cast iron and very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Harry S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best portable grill I’ve ever owned. I usually purchase the cheaper portable grills, they last a couple years and I throw them out since they are hard to find parts for. This grill is easy to clean and can find all the parts you need in store or online. I also purchased the cart and it’s the perfect combo
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weber Tail Gate Grills the Best
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. Actually seems better than older model with heavier grates. This new model heats up faster and comes with a temp gauge screwed into the hood. Everything goes together very easily. The weber grills really heat up compared to others. I use this grill several times per week and it works beautifully. And I have cooked everything from lobster to filet mignon and they all came out fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: lilly

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came in more colors - but still love it!
customer_reviews.text: This looks perfect in the bigger stand! I wish it came in more fun colors - that would be my only complaint. The color options were boring. This BBQ is great and easy to move around and use. It is also easy to clean and maintain. I wish it had come with the hose - it seems crazy you also have to buy an additional hose.
customer_reviews.author: Nannie D.

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Q1000 series grill that I had used for 8 years with this Q2000 series. I'm very happy with the larger size of the Q2000, as well as the nice ignitor and thermometer. The grill seems to be slightly cooler in the center area compared to areas directly over the burner ring, but not a real issue. It has plenty of power - even on the lowest setting the temperature gets above 350, but not an issue to put a small object to prop open the lid a bit. Would highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: EllieCapelli

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: Weber grills are the best, and this one lives up to the reputation. Very heavy grates work well in distributing the heat, the one burner wraps around the cooking area and works well. The only shortcoming is that the gas cylinders don't last much past 2 usages, but I figured that would be the case when I purchased it. Plenty of cooking space for four people.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Sear

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning issues
customer_reviews.text: I have problems keeping the holes for the flames open or clean
customer_reviews.author: John A Bilgere

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Weber Q. First one was sold with my RV. Second one just got worn out after seven years (I live in a wet salty environment where everything outside falls apart sooner or later). This one is an improvement over the first two. The new igniter works great and the shelves are more sturdy. The BTU level of the top of the line model is also higher and that gives you a lot more heat control. It was always a good product, now it is better.
customer_reviews.author: Cami Blancheri

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Weber!
customer_reviews.text: What can you say. It’s a Weber. Can never go wrong with a Weber. Should’ve got long ago after I went through a couple Coleman Road Trip grills. Fits perfect in RV storage and is just awesome! Went together easy. Easy operation. So happy
customer_reviews.author: T. Coyle

customer_reviews.title: The best portable grill money can buy!
customer_reviews.text: I owned the Q100 (now known as Q1000) grill since 2011 and decided to upgrade to the Q2200. The Q100 was indestructible and I still use it, but it was too small for my growing family. The Q2200 is a great size and I expect it to last just as long as my Q100. Weber does a great job with these portable camping grills!
customer_reviews.author: M.McFly

customer_reviews.title: Good versatility but medium value
customer_reviews.text: Works fairly well. Flame is easily swayed by a breeze. Definitely not ideal for open top cooking, more meant for convection cooking under rounded top. Portability is good with cart I bought. Value is on lower side as price for the grill and cart is pretty high for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Krup

customer_reviews.title: We love the Q-grill
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one we have purchased each one a size up. We first got the small one for tailgating but loved it so much we got a bigger size and now we we have this size and can cook more and bigger stuff. We love it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: linda rout

customer_reviews.title: Q 2200 - Quality Well Made Portable Weber Grill at a reasonable price with Excellent support
customer_reviews.text: Quality well made portable grill at a reasonable price with excellent support. Recently cooked 10 hamburgers at one time with no problem at all. You will use this grill so often I highly recommend the propane tank converter OR the Weber 6525 Q Cart which come with the propane tank adapter. Unlike my previous grill, which was so big it had to be left outside on the porch in the winter, this grill will be stored INSIDE.
customer_reviews.author: DG&RG

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed that I spent the money on this grill. The heat is not equally distributed. Food cooks unequally. The heat pipes are always clogged. The side tables won’t hold even a plate without bending and the plate dropping. So bummed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill
customer_reviews.text: Best portable grill ever. Customer service is awesome if you ever need it. This was a gift for my dad. I purchased the same grill 8 years ago (200 in stead of 2000). But same grill. I had issues with my regulated at about year 5. Called customer service and they shipped me a new one for free with instruction on how to change it. My dad loves it too. He has it sitting on top of his 1,500 stainless grill that he is now ready to sell and uses this one all the time
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great size for most people
customer_reviews.text: Great size and portability, heats up quickly. The last few grills I have purchased have been way too large for me. If you regularly grill for 20+ people, this will be too small to serve everyone at the same time. But, you can easily fit 9 burgers and 8 hot dogs without crowding, just make two runs and you’re covered.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan's Guide

customer_reviews.title: will not stay lit if windy!
customer_reviews.text: Your response is not helpful--as I said in the first sentence, it works fine when warm and sunny--it will not stay lit if there is any wind!!!Posting "canned responses" is a waste of time!!!Figure out a workable wind screen!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I expected but very nice!
customer_reviews.text: A bit bigger then I expected but it's a great size for the family of 8. I am getting a smaller one for vacations although. My only complaint and other's complaints that I can see is the starter button easily comes off and you lose it. I've bought a few starter buttons in the 2 months I've had the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazdnu

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Weber - second Baby Q. This grill works great - the porcelain grill top is easy to clean. The thermometer in the lid is nice to let you know what the lid temperature is. I replaced a Q 200 - the 2200 is a nice upgrade. My hope is they redesigned the gas regulator so that it lasts a lot longer than the one on the Q 200. After the second one went bad - and the cast iron grate started rusting - it was time for replacement. As much as I looked at other grills, the Weber Q series are the best I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is just the right size for our family. It’s made of sturdy materials and easy to setup. I cooked some 2” steaks the first time and they came out Great!
customer_reviews.author: Rem

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. Much better then the Coleman Portable stove I owned previously. The throw away aluminum grease catchers also worked like a charm. Clean up was easy, was able to push the spilled food into the grease catcher and dispose of. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hair

customer_reviews.title: Great balcony grill
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a 6'x6' balcony with a table and chairs. I took off one of the shelves easily by unscrewing 2 screws and then replacing them. Easy to clean, food tastes great and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Dog mother

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this grill
customer_reviews.text: I've grilled soooo many dinners on this grill. If you live in an apartment, this is the perfect grill. Big enough, but portable. I got the stand that goes with it, and it sits at just the right height.
customer_reviews.author: C K Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Sets up fast, is easy to use and clean, and gets HOT
customer_reviews.text: This grill sets up fast, is easy to use and clean, and I was surprised how hot it gets -- the thermometer in the lid went above 500 degrees when I left it on and closed to test it. That was unexpected and awesome. I recommend getting the adapter hose if you use this at home a lot so you can hook it up to a full-size propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: David Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great portable Grill!
customer_reviews.text: Wow great grill! You don’t need a huge big grill to make great food! Last big grill just rusted and had to go. This this is so portable and easy to use it will last for ever out of the rain and elements! Highly recommend this grill! Heat output is great! Grill surface grates are very heavy duty!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: QUICK TO HEAT, SO HANDY TO USE.
customer_reviews.text: We have owned many webers, loved them all! this is a perfect size for small family, perfect for retired couple. Heat up the outdoors during the summer, anything you can cook in your oven can be cooked on this weber. I have NOT tried to bake, but with thermometer why not?
customer_reviews.author: MMH

customer_reviews.title: In need of a portable grill
customer_reviews.text: The grill has great heat and super to take with us. Easy to set up too. Electric igniter and fast start. Loves the side trays. It does go thru mini bottles but carry at least a bottle per 2 day of usage . But as for dislikes... weight ( normal ) but metal. So the recommendation is GET IT !
customer_reviews.author: scotty

customer_reviews.title: Reiable, consistent even temperature across grill
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Q grill, but this one is larger than our other. They are durable, easy to clean and store, and provide a good even temperature throughout the grill surface. The Q reliably grills in wind, rain and even snow.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila M Endres

customer_reviews.title: Best portable grill ever.
customer_reviews.text: This grill is fantastic. I've used it several times since I've bought it. It's only one burner and I was skeptical at first, but it had outperformed my expectations. It gets really hot, really fast. I think the reason it retains heat so well is because it's ceramic coated. You will not be disappointed if you make this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this grill
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this grill. The only issue is that it is not very good for indirect grilling, but that's really not what it's designed for. I bought this with the portable cart and the adapter hose for a full-size propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: CntrClckWise

customer_reviews.title: Spend the $$ and upgrade to a larger cooking surface
customer_reviews.text: So much more surface area than the smaller 1200. And easier to clean, I think. The 1200 still lives on, but goes with us camping in our RV.
customer_reviews.author: aprilrrain

customer_reviews.title: awesome little grill
customer_reviews.text: I had recently purchased a big green egg and did not like it. Too much drama as i dont care about the "experience", I just wanted a small table top grill for my wife and I, I didnt want the usual home depot or lowes grill, made of thin sheet metal, and would last a couple of years. I bought the Q2200, cast aluminum, heats evenly, sturdy. If you have a screwdriver and know how to read its a snap to put together. I really like this grill, well worth the money. Typical good Amazon, ordered had it at my door in 2 days. BOOM!
customer_reviews.author: linda oliverio

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I had and they both have the same problem. They wont light I had to replace the regulator on the first one and now the second one is doing the exact same thing . I would rate the whole thing a zero star if I could
customer_reviews.author: dennis horning

customer_reviews.title: This grill is the quality you’d expect from a Weber
customer_reviews.text: This thing has a larger surface area than I expected. The size is deceiving. Great heat. Easy to clean, easy to transport. I recommend purchasing the cover and the stand it sits on. If You ge the stand then transporting it will be similar to walking with a carry-on w rollers.
customer_reviews.author: E. G.

customer_reviews.title: Heat Low
customer_reviews.text: I have older versions of this Weber. And heat output was very much higher. I am very disappointed with this new product. I would not recommend this product. If I had not recycled box, I would have send back!
customer_reviews.author: LMF

customer_reviews.title: Weber BBQ is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This our second bbq by Weber for our RV. We wore the first one out with tailgate parties and camping trips. Works great. Side food up to make it compact. Even grilling.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Love the grill, I use it all the time. It is small, compact, portable, and easy to use. The only problem I have is the flame on the front part of the gas range seems to go out every so often.
customer_reviews.author: Mayer L.

customer_reviews.title: Recieved with a broken leg
customer_reviews.text: Recieved with a broken leg, could be a fine grill but I cant tell you how disappointing it is that its legs are too weak and flimsy to survive transport to my door. Box was in fine condition so it wasnt too traumatic of an event that was enough to break it.
customer_reviews.author: Tuxedob166er

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for couples, not so great for families!
customer_reviews.text: Really small, it’s hard to get a meal for more than a couple people to fit on it!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Basch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill, just what you would expect from Weber
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill, just what you would expect from Weber. The only complaint I have, and someone else mentioned this as well, is the fact the gas valve doesn't have a positive stop in the off position. I too grabbed it out of my truck this weekend to find the gas valve in the on position. You'll also want to have a piece of tin foil on hand so that when you close the side tables they are not resting directly on whatever food remnants happen to be on the cooking grates. Other than that. great grill!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: I got this grill for my boyfriend and he has since declared it to be the best birthday present ever, bar none. He uses it weekly for tailgating after his softball games and is able to cook food for his whole team quickly and evenly. The one thing he recommends is getting the adapter hose so that you can hook it up to a full-sized propane tank. He did have the rolling case for this grill, but it got torn and has since been discontinued. Please bring back the case!
customer_reviews.author: CD Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Not really too portable but works great
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it for camping or tailgating but for my family of four it's a perfect size. I have in on a Weber stand. If you do want to move it around, take out the grill since it's so heavy. But that's what also makes it so great.
customer_reviews.author: A. Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Urban Grilling NYC
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill! Heats up quickly and is extremely hot. Grills anything to perfection. Follow the plastic cooking brochure for perfect cook times. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Arto Zeronian

customer_reviews.title: Made lamb chops that seared great! Just let your grill come up to temperature ...
customer_reviews.text: Made lamb chops that seared great! Just let your grill come up to temperature for about 10-15 mins! Replaced my Weber Q 200 with this and am not disappointed one bit!
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grill for us. Retired so just the 2 of us most of the time but will grill for 4 to 6 when the occasion a raises. Can take to the beach or to an outing without much work and the mere fact we can to that is great.
customer_reviews.author: PapaHop

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than expected, but good quality
customer_reviews.text: We were surprised by how heavy it is, but you can feel the quality. Nicest BBQ we've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Simons/Sutor

customer_reviews.title: Q 2200 great addition to my grilling addiction :)
customer_reviews.text: After ordering the q2200, I read and read review after review... A few we're complaining about the grill arriving damaged... MINE WAS IN PERFECT WORKING CONDITION. Do wish the flames were a little higher, to give steaks a mean char, but knew what to expect and this grill can grill a MEAN ribeye. I am a weber JUNKY LOL, and this is my 4th one ...2 jumbo joes-great for smoking pork butts, a 26.75" kettle-great for smoking ANYTHING, and now the q2200... ALL ARE AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: jwtxs

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent grill; I am very pleased with it. I replaced a much larger, older full-size grill (a Q-300). This one when used with the more expensive stand, works great for my needs. It is hard to beat Weber grills.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Seller to work with  !!
customer_reviews.text: BBQ came in perfect condition but I needed one smaller for my trailer storage compartment. Seller was helpful in making my return ! Thank you !!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: This model is the best. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews. This model is the best. Easy to use, easy to clean, compact but does exactly what I need. I generally will only cook a couple of meals at a time for myself. It will be perfect for the entertaining that I do that is on the small.scale. propane is the way to go ..I've certainly tried all the other types. Weber is a quality product and I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great steak (or anything) cooker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean. Lasts forever. Cooks great. Gotta be patient and give it time to heat up. But, It will get to 600 deg. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Slowlane

customer_reviews.title: BEST GRILL EVERY
customer_reviews.text: If I try to light the grill and it does not come on after the first or second strike, I'm done. This grill, one click and its on. I love the temperature gauge on the outside as well. Very well built grill. We love WEBER GRILLS!
customer_reviews.author: DMBarry

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill. Weber never disappoints.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the grill and the fold out side tables and built in temperature gauge. Previously had a much larger members mark grill which was too big for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Judy H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased one in the past and the only reason I got a new one is because I wanted a larger one. I have a stand, which I was able to use with the new one, too. The 2200 webber grill is easy to use. I turn the knob to high and press the button to fire it up. I like the small propane tanks because they are easy to change. The cost of one is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great grill. It stays in my RV
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grill. It stays in my RV. It is large enough to cook for a large family. It is only the wife and I, but we do have lots of company when out in the RV. Bought the smaller one foe my Dad for his birthday and he just loves it also. Loe the thermometer so I can watch the temp and know when to cook. Really important when searing steak!
customer_reviews.author: Elliott S Corbett

product_meta.title: Weber 54060001 Q2200 Liquid Propane Grill,Gray
product_meta.description: Color:GrayRestyled for 2014, the Weber Q 220 is now the Weber Q 2200. The grill has the same great performance and sleek styling, but adds new aesthetics that are both functional and fun, including larger grip handle and control knobs, ergonomic side handles, sturdy front and rear cradles, larger-sized fold-out side tables with greater rigidity plus the familiar Weber Q logo prominently branded in the lid. Split grates allow for a grate/griddle cooking combination: Just replace one of the grates with the Q 2000-series compatible griddle (sold separately) and experience an alternative way to prepare breakfast, lunch and dinner on your grill. The tall lid accommodates the grilling of small roasts and birds, while the large built-in thermometer allows you to monitor temperatures inside the grill. The Weber Q 2200 is ideal for use when camping and tailgating but, thanks to a design that offers both compact overall size and large grilling surface, can double as a stationary grill in your outdoor living space. The grill runs on disposable LP cylinders (not included), but an optional LP adapter hose for 20-lb. tanks is available as an accessory. A seamless stainless steel burner is your assurance of durability and long-lasting performance. The cast-aluminum lid and body are both lightweight and rugged. May be used with Weber Portable Cart model #6557 and Q Cart model #6525.Fuel type : Liquid Petroleum Gas (disposable cartridge sold separately)
feature_bullets: Stainless steel burner puts out 12,000 BTU-per-hour
Electronic ignition with built in thermometer
Dimensions - Lid Closed and Tables Out (inches): 15.5"H x 51.4"W x 19.5"D
3D interactive assembly instructions for this product are available through the free BILT app.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
